Detailed Description

A subclass of a QUuid.

A Universally Unique Identifier (Uuid) is a standard way to uniquely identify entities in a distributed computing environment

Member Function Documentation

◆ operator size_t()

rev::Uuid::operator size_t ( ) const
explicit
Note
Will only preserve ID for manually-specified Uuids that are smaller than sizeof(unsigned int)
